definition[0]: to repair something that is broken or not working properly
example[0]: He’s outside fixing the brakes on the car.
example[1]: Ellis was able to quickly find and fix the problem.
definition[1]: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change
example[2]: The interest rate has been fixed at 6.5%.
example[3]: Rent was fixed at $1,750 per month.
definition[2]: if two or more companies fix the price for a particular product or service, they secretly agree on the price they will charge for it, in order to keep the price high and make more profit. This practice is illegal
example[4]: The government accused the two companies of fixing petrol prices.
example[5]: ‘So when do I get to meet them?’ ‘Tomorrow, if I can fix it.’
example[6]: I’ve fixed for you to see him this afternoon at four.
note[1]: fix (it) for somebody to do something
definition[4]: to attach something firmly to something else, so that it stays there permanently
example[7]: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
definition[5]: to prepare a meal or drinks
example[8]: I’ll watch the kids and you fix dinner.
example[9]: Terry fixed herself a cold drink and sat out on the balcony.
example[10]: Can I fix you a snack?
definition[6]: to find a solution to a problem or bad situation
example[11]: The government seems confident that environmental problems can be fixed.
definition[7]: to make your hair or make-up look neat and attractive
example[12]: Who fixed your hair for the wedding?
example[13]: Hold on. Let me just fix my face (=put on make-up) before we go out.
definition[8]: to do a medical operation on a cat or dog so that it cannot have babies
definition[9]: to arrange an election, game etc dishonestly, so that you get the result you want
example[14]: Many suspected that the deal had been fixed in advance.
definition[10]: to use a chemical process on paintings, photographs etc that makes the colours or images permanent
definition[11]: used to say that you will punish someone you are angry with
example[15]: If anybody did that to me, I’d fix him good.
example[16]: Robinson called the proposal a quick fix (=a temporary or easy solution) of limited value.
definition[13]: an amount of something, especially an illegal drug such as heroin, that you often use and badly want
example[18]: I need my fix of caffeine in the morning or I can’t think.
definition[14]: something that has been dishonestly arranged
example[19]: People think the election was a fix.
example[20]: We had to fix some computer problems.
example[21]: It will cost millions of dollars tofix the system.
definition[16]: to decide on a level, value etc for something
example[22]: It is very difficult to fix an offer price several weeks in advance.
example[23]: They agreed to fix a time for the interview.
example[24]: Mike wants to fix up a meeting with you.
definition[17]: to arrange something dishonestly in order to get the result you want
example[25]: We suspected that the deal had been fixed in advance.
example[26]: Allegations of a fix were not proven.
example[27]: Obviously his appointment was a fix.
definition[18]: a solution to a problem, especially if the solution is temporary
example[28]: They do not want aquick fix, they want a resolution of the issues.
example[29]: Is there a fix for the suffering Caribbean economy?
definition[19]: a solution to a computer software problem
example[30]: Do not apply this fix if you are running a Power PC Mac.
example[31]: The bug fixes in previous versions of the software are also included in the current update.
definition[20]: to understand what someone or something is really like
example[32]: Investors are trying to get a fix on Sony’s future.
